text:
As Prince Charles walked his new daughter-in-law Meghan Markle down the second half of the aisle at St. George's Chapel, the beaming bride was walking calmly and confidently on the arm of the next King of England.

Interested in Royal Family? Add Royal Family as an interest to stay up to date on the latest Royal Family news, video, and analysis from ABC News. Add Interest

Markle's mother, Doria Ragland, had escorted the bride to the church before Markle walked the first half of the aisle on her own.

Danny Lawson/AP

Jonathan Brady/PA

Prince Harry, who stood at the altar with his best man and older brother Prince William, spoke with his new bride as she arrived, telling her, "You look amazing."

Jonathan Brady/Reuters

Markle handed off her bouquet to a young bridesmaid before the ceremony began, during which the prince and his bride held hands.

Markle, 36, asked Prince Charles to walk her down the aisle because her father, Thomas Markle Sr., who lives in Mexico, did not attend the wedding due to health concerns.
title: A look at the unforgettable moment Prince Charles walked Meghan Markle down the aisle
